item.title: Jacob Rodal
item.description: Greetings! My name is Jacob Rodal and I’m a software engineer based out of Seattle working at Facebook. I graduated from the University of Virignia School of Engineering and Applied Science where I double majored in computer science and statistics. My technical interests include internet privacy, VR/AR technology, backend development, home automation, vim, and Linux. Resource Link Blog /posts/ Github https://www.github.com/jrodal98/ LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/in/jacob-rodal/ aesthetic resume /docs/aesthetic_resume.pdf plain resume /docs/resume.pdf unofficial transcript /docs/jrodal_transcript.pdf

item.title: Fix Gray Overlay When Video Sharing on Zoom
item.description: Are you a Compton/Picom user that has a gray overlay that appears when sharing or recording your screen when using zoom? Here’s a possible fix.

item.title: How to Deploy a Rocket Rust Web Application on VPS
item.description: Tutorial for deploying a web application using Rocket, Virmach VPS, nginx, letsencrypt, systemd, and Github Actions.

item.title: File sharing from the command line
item.description: An overview of 0x0.st and transfer.sh, two popular file sharing services that you can use for free from the command line.

item.title: Dropdown/Scratchpad Terminals with i3
item.description: Tutorial on implementing dropdown terminals in i3 using the scratchpad feature

item.title: Dunst Action
item.description: A discussion on my Dunst screenshot actions, which include OCR, uploading to 0x0.st, deletion, renaming, and movement to/from clipboard

item.title: Launching Scripts from a Smartwatch
item.description: This article explains how to execute shell commands on a Linux computer from an android smartphone and a WearOS smartwatch.
